Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and polite staff”
Reviews.Author: trukstonehughG
Reviews.Content: Just few words to say that our experience at the view was great! Location is the best you could desire if being in Rome as you are AT the spanish steps! The high quality service made our stay pleasant and enjoyable. Thanks to all the staff!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service!”
Reviews.Author: greenwichstych
Reviews.Content: I will book this place every time I'll go back to Rome as it is perfect under any point of view: good value for money, very well appointed room, ultra central location and the friendly staff. A special Thanks goes to Giordana and Karina who helped us so much!

Reviews.Title: “Stylish room and great staff”
Reviews.Author: hussaintrzog
Reviews.Content: We love this place! It was our second time there and we'll probably go back next year. Location is perfect: spanish steps is truly the heart of Rome. And the front desk staff is polite and professional. They deserved this positive feed back!

Reviews.Title: “A great stay in the sunny Rome”
Reviews.Author: clorindafyshman
Reviews.Content: We reserved two connecting rooms at the view (they called it family room on the web site) and prepaid online to get a discount. I found their web site very clear and easy to use. We have two children and connecting rooms were perfect because we could close the main door and have half of the floor for our private use. The view from the two rooms was amazing! The staff helped us with tours reservations (they were able to reserve tickets for borghese gallery and vatican museums) and provided great suggestions for dinner and things to do. We loved Rome and the View!

Reviews.Title: “The most beautiful place we've ever been!”
Reviews.Author: kirchbammglor
Reviews.Content: Amazing! We've been there for a couple of days and it was not enough... We must go back to enjoy Rome and we'll book again the view. The room was beautiful, spacious and clean. Staff is very professional and friendly. Overall, a fantastic stay!

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular view from the corner suite”
Reviews.Author: henryhankvanwilt
Reviews.Content: My travel agent suggested me to try the View for my stay in Rome. She said she had booked that for some other clients and heard such beautiful things about it. I trusted her and I can now add my positive comments to the others already published on tripadvisor. I was travelling with my wife and our little daughter and the suite was perfect for the three of us. The living room is separate from the bedroom and there is a sofa bed which can become a comfortable single bed. As the living room is separate by a door from the bedroom, it's like having booked two connecting rooms. The view is unique and the staff is very efficient. It's been a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing suite!”
Reviews.Author: grubbfranny
Reviews.Content: If you are planning a trip to Rome, the View is the place to stay! Rooms are beautiful and the view from there is just....wow! I booked the suite (it was more expensive than the double room, but it worth it!) as anniversary surprise for my wife and she was shocked by the breathtaking view of the steps from our balcony. The suite is huge, with a master bedroom (king size bed!) and a living room; jacuzzi bath in our bathroom, also providing walking shower and double basins. Internet connection is free of charge and we could easily surf on the web. The staff pampered us and made our stay memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Priceless view and wonderful service”
Reviews.Author: knutreyess
Reviews.Content: It's hard to explain in few words how much we've enjoyed our stay at the View. At check in we've been welcomed by the smiling Karina and Pasquale, who escorted to our rooms and helped us with our bags. The room was beautiful, with jacuzzi bath! The view from our window was amazing and we've decided to extend our sta for one more night. Luckly the room was still available and the front desk staff has been so kind to apply the same rate (which was very reasonable for the service offered). No need to say that the location is just perfect!

Reviews.Title: “A great stay!”
Reviews.Author: moniquetcalais
Reviews.Content: I believe Rome it's one of the most beautiful cities in the world.... For sure the view is the best place to stay if seeking a room with stunning view of the spanish steps! And if you, like us, are so lucky to be in rome and stay at the view while a snowfall is taking place, then you could not ask for anything else! The atmosphere at the spanish steps was magic with the snow! And we enhoyed every little moment of our vacation. This has been possible also because our room was fantastic and the staff was truly helpful and attentive. Lovely stay indeed!

Reviews.Title: “Top location”
Reviews.Author: PFam_11
Reviews.Content: The view from the room, the flower filled outside breakfast area, the fabulous location and excellent service make this hotel worthwhile. The downsides are the slightly spartan, dated decor of the rooms and more importantly the rock hard bed. After staying in a variety of hotels over a 3 week vacation, we really noticed the difference in sleep quality at the View. However, the central location and great service of all the staff won us over. If the bed issue is addressed we would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent small hotel in an amazing city !”
Reviews.Author: mikcal
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for a long week end in Rome. The location is great, in the heart of Rome with a unique view on Spanish steps! Staff were very friendly and attentive. We had a really wonderful, relaxing stay . Our room was so beautiful and so clean and had a beautiful balcony. Next time in Rome we look forward to staying in this hotel again and we will recommend this hotel to our friends !

Reviews.Title: “Unique view of the steps!”
Reviews.Author: sorkinjandyy
Reviews.Content: We had such a great time at the View! It's only two days ago, but we already miss our wonderful room... The view from there is just great! And the staff was lovely and kind enough to help us in making lots of tour and restaurant reservation. We appreciated the evening turndown service and the private breakfast served in the lounge.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing stay.”
Reviews.Author: Kelmoc
Reviews.Content: You just cannot beat the view from this hotel. We stayed in the Junior Suite and it was spacious, beautifully furnished and had a wonderful bathroom. The wrap-around balcony was amazing and gave us a breathtaking view of the Spanish Steps and Via Condotti. The staff was very attentive and helpful in so many ways…great restaurant recommendations, perfect directions and fluent English. In particular, Jordana went above and beyond to make our stay enjoyable. The night before we left, my wife noticed the boots she purchased were different sizes. Unfortunately, our car to the airport was leaving at the same time the store opened the following morning. Jordana decided she would go to the store and convince them to open up early and exchange the boots for us so we could get to the airport on time. She succeeded! This is a great example of just how considerate all the staff was during our stay. What a wonderful place to stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “The best place we've ever been....”
Reviews.Author: lisbethbergman
Reviews.Content: We loved the view! Everything was perfect during our stay: fast check in with friendly staff, delicious breakfast served on a beatiful terrace surrounded by lemon trees (could you imagine that???) and a nice room witha breathtaking view of the most famous steps in the world...we felt like movie stars..... Wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location!”
Reviews.Author: rwasikolov
Reviews.Content: The view impresses us for its superb location! We booked the junior suite and the view from the room was even better than what we could expect.... Simply fantastic! Our junior suite was huge with a comfortable sitting room and a spacious bathroom with both shower and bathtub. The staff reserved us a warm welcome and made a great job in confirming restaurant and museum reservations. We had a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Rome with a View”
Reviews.Author: Mike R
Reviews.Content: We started our Italian adventure in late August in Rome and were fortunate to book a good deal here for 3 nights. The View is associated with the Inn at the Steps which is the larger hotel about 3 doors away. With only 4 rooms it gives a very personal experience with excellent service from everyone involved. The rooms are well appointed with everything you will need and the location is perfect, overlooking the Spanish Steps gives you the 'buzz' and feeling of Rome but once the windows are sealed it is nice and quiet for a great sleep. A truly personal, private and memorable stay; a touch on the expensive side but location and service do not come cheap in any major city in the world, so in our books well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have been any better!”
Reviews.Author: MisterK928
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, phantastic service. We loved the very private atmosphere of the place. Very good, well furnished and equipped room, own comfortable lounge and sun terrace for the few guest of the hotel, Views and location are very phantastic. Very lavish breakfast. Unusual arrangement (top floor of an old residential building, old-style concierge watching the over the building, creaky old lift to get you to the top floor, lobby in neighbouring hotel) - adding up to a very pleasant, secluded base for exploring the city.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint, perfect!!! Exactly as I imagined it would be!!!”
Reviews.Author: trutruwillo
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, friendly and knowledgeable staff (Franco was amazing!!!), quaint and perfect. And right beside a great tea room serving the most amazing coffee!!!! Great introduction to Rome, perfect way to end our vacation!!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location at the Spanish steps!”
Reviews.Author: chattykathy1958
Reviews.Content: The staff and hotel at the Spanish steps were so friendly and it was so wonderful to be able to step out of our hotel and walk everywhere! I highly recommend this hotel for a good night sleep and especially for the location! We were lucky to get a room in July during the busy season and we will definitely reserve our room early when we return to Rome next year.

Reviews.Title: “Want to feel like a movie star?!”
Reviews.Author: markedin1
Reviews.Content: Got a last minute deal on their top suite (Junior Suite - Room 801) and it did not disappoint. Stayed 2 nights in total. Website quotes price as over 1000 euros per night but I managed to get it for just over 500 euros. Certainly not cheap but top quality Rome hotel rooms are not cheap and, if you can get this room for 500 euros, you would be mad not to take it! Not the easiest hotel to find in the world as the "reception" is located in a different building from the room I stayed in. Reception is literally next door to Cafe Grecco and is not the most signposted. My room was in antoher building about 4 doors up Via Condotti towards the Spanish Steps. On the top floor with what looked like 2 suites. My suite had a separate living room, great bathroom (although the shower did not drain away) but I did not care as there was another shower over the bath. Big bedroom with 3 patio doors leading to a private balcony with the most incredible view over the Spanish Steps. Noisy during the day and into evening but, as I sit here at 11pm typing, all tourists have disappared and it is completely quiet. My suite and the suite next door share another communal living area which is a lovely space where breakfast is served. It has access to a charming larger patio where I sat this morning for breakfast. I would most certainly book this place again but I would want another deal as would not want to pay the full website quoted price. You cannot help feel like a complete movie star walking out onto your balcony overlooking everyone and admiring the staggering view!!

Reviews.Title: “Cosy and personal”
Reviews.Author: JackHerrer
Reviews.Content: A nice very Cenral hotel with a personal touch. Nice rooms , good service small and cosy. Moved here after a great dissapointment at the Eden. Great !!!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutly lovely”
Reviews.Author: Beverleyp
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 three nights at the View in September. The private area made it feel as though you were in your own private appartment not a hotel. Our room overlooked the Spanish steps which could be quite noisy at night although this didn't stop us sleeping. The breakfast on the terrace was lovely. Franco at the front desk was very helpful. Only complaint was, as it was the weekend someone from the Inn had to unlock outside door for us when ever we returned to hotel. Location was unbelievable,walking distance to lovely restaurants. Unfortunatly the credit card suffered a little with all the amazing shops literally out the front door! Can't wait to return

Reviews.Title: “beware!!”
Reviews.Author: Zella
Reviews.Content: Oh dear! We were so looking forward to our stay at the view, and im sure it would have been lovely if we had made it there. We booked our room at the view as part of our honeymoon for this August. The hotel looks so funky, and with an air of a private apartment. We wanted somewhere boutique, small and modern( difficult in rome), so this was perfect. We phoned and emailed the hotel, who then emailed to confirm our stay...great...until 6 weeks before our honeymoon they emailed us to tell us they had made a mistake and the whole view is now booked by one person who wants to reserve it for themselves!!! so they clearly didnt care about our confirmed booking, and wanted to get the whole place booked in one go=more money for them. This is the problem with a hotel that can be booked either a six seperate rooms or inits entireity. Obviously they do not care about guests, just profit. Very poor indeed, especially as this was to be our honeymoon. They did offer us alternative accomodation, but we didnt like it, nor them, for treating us so badly..why would we want to give them our custom now? We told them of our dissapointment, and they could not have cared less. We are now going to The Hassler who have been marvellous so far..will review it when we return! fingers crossed!

Reviews.Title: “We were treated like celebrities! We LOVED The View!!!”
Reviews.Author: RachelShingleton
Reviews.Content: Like the poster below, this is also our love letter to The View at the Spanish Steps. We were initially very sticker shocked (appx 600 euro plus for a room??), but everything we read said that The View was worth it. And oh my goodness, was it ever! We arrived on a rainy Thursday afternoon at the Spanish Steps. We walked down to The Inn at the Spanish Steps, only a few feet away. The View is separate from its owner, The Inn at the Spanish Steps, located on Via dei Condotti, the Rodeo Drive of Rome. You must check in first at The Inn, where we were treated like royalty by Franco, the most friendly and personal hotel staff member we've ever met. We were escorted to The View, which is located in a private building just a few feet away from the Inn. It is located between two Prada stores and across from Gucci. It doesn't get any more glamourous than that, or so we thought. We were led into the building, and onto an old-fashioned elevator (read: seemingly rickety, but altogether charming and solid). We were on the sixth floor and the door was opened onto the most beautiful living room, the first of two. Outside was a beautiful terrace. Our room was #802, La Scalinata, next to the Keats & Shelley Suite. We only saw one other person the entire time we were there, despite being told that the entire View was booked (4 rooms total, I believe --- you can see a plan of the layout on their website). The public areas were beautifully decorated, but when we entered our room, it took our breath away. We've been in many beautiful hotel rooms around the world, but this one took the cake, by far. The view alone was stunning; at the time, the azaleas were out on the Spanish Steps, and it was truly breathtaking. It was somewhat noisy with the windows open, but not noticeable at night in any way. The bathroom was enormous; decorated in marble with two enormous pedestal sinks, a toilet, and a bidet. The best part was the freestanding shower, as well as a tub; in the shower, there was a rain showerhead, which made my 6-foot-4-inch husband happy since he didn't have to lean over to get wet! Breakfast was included, out in the living rooms. It was always a beautiful spread, and we ate out on the terrace. Our only complaint was that the pillows were very hard. If you need a softer pillow, we would recommend that you take your own. But that's pretty much standard for European hotels; no Heavenly Beds a la Westin here! Otherwise, the sheets were soft and we were very comfortable. All in all, the location is perfect in town. We could walk easily all over Rome and it is close to the Trevi Fountain and the Pantheon. Be sure to eat lots of gelato and windowshop on the Via dei Condotti. The restaurants in the area are divine. It was the most expensive room we've ever been in, but they treat you so well that it is worth every last penny. We would highly recommend it to anyone and we would just love to go back. It was romantic, beautiful, and the most memorable trip we've ever taken together.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have spend five days in this very special place. Every morning before breakfast I was used to open the window and look at spanish steps. very nice...

Reviews.Title: “Fell in Love with Rome here”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was there in March of 2003. The hotel is located in the perfect spot for walking tours all over the city. Everything was within walking distance. The hotel itself being at the most famous landmark of Rome, The Spanish steps,was wonderful. With all of the famous shopping streets ending at the hotel everything was within reach. I would recomend this hotel to anyone going and have already. Im planning my next trip in March and will plan to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Visit!”
Reviews.Author: JFE
Reviews.Content: We had a very pleasant stay at Palio Bianco for 4 nights in November, 2003. Our room looked out to the Spanish Steps and we enjoyed watching the people come and go or just sitting and having a good time. The location is excellent, a Metro right around the corner, easy access to many Rome attractions, great shopping at Via Condotti and lots of food places close by. We had a nice size room, always cleaned and breakfast was delivered to our room at whatever time we requested. Front desk staff left after hours but we were issued necessary keys for access to building, floor and our room. Wouldn't mind staying next time and I can recommend especially for first time visitors in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience at the Palio Bianco Spanish Steps”
Reviews.Author: JEB1948
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Palio Bianco Spanish Steps November 1 - 4, 2003 and had a wonderful experience in a great location. The hotel is right next to the Metro stop for easy access to the Colleseum or the Vatican, and there is a cab stand out front. There are many food and beverage options nearby, plus fine dining and upscale shopping on the Via Condotti and surrounding streets. Many notable sites are within easy walking distance, such as the Trevi Fountain or Parthenon. The staff was friendly and helpful (our only Italian language abilities came out of a phrase book). With only 10 rooms the atmosphere is homey. )Our bed was comfortable and breakfast was satisfactory and the ambience of the Spanish Steps is wonderful and we were lucky enough to have a room directly overlooking them. Overall, we found this hotel to be a good value.
